meanings.sent1: The toy had an oofy shape.
meanings.sent2: The cloud looked oofy in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so oofy that it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as oofy as a bubble popping.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's fur felt oofy to the touch.

meanings.definition: (noun) a person or thing that is oofy
meanings.sent1: She was known as the oofy in our group.
meanings.sent2: The tree stump was the oofy in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The oofy at the party made everyone laugh with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood in the field like an oofy sentinel.
meanings.sent5: The little bird chirped happily, unaware of being the oofy in the garden.

meanings.definition: (verb) to act in a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: He tends to oofy around when he's nervous.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally oofied her way through the dance routine.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to oofy its way out of the tight space.
meanings.sent4: The comedian oofied his lines, making the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent5: The toddler oofied along the hallway, bumping into furniture.
